meanings.definition: To remove all contents from (a container)
meanings.sent1: She emptied the basket of apples into the bowl.
meanings.sent2: After the party, he emptied the trash can filled with paper plates.
meanings.sent3: The magician emptied the hat, but instead of a rabbit, a bunch of flowers appeared!
meanings.sent4: His laughter emptied the room of tension, filling it with joy instead.
meanings.sent5: The storm emptied the streets as people sought shelter from the rain.

meanings.sent1: The lake slowly emptied as the drought continued.
meanings.sent2: The theater emptied out quickly after the movie ended.
meanings.sent3: The classroom emptied in a flash when the bell rang for recess.
meanings.sent4: Her heart emptied of sadness as she focused on the happy memories.
meanings.sent5: The bottle emptied its contents into the glass, ready to be enjoyed.
